Authors: L. H. Blumenschein, M. Koehler, N. S. Usevitch, E. W. Hawkes, D. C. Rucker and A. M. Okamura
Features: Allows actuation between two shapes, Used to shape helical tendon paths
Limitations: Non-linear buckling and wrinkling buckled point has lower stiffness than rest of tube

Authors: E. Franco
Features: Nonlinear controller achieves consistent regulation with no overshoot, Observer compensates effect of external forces
Limitations: Larger diameters require higher control effort

Authors: I. Exarchos, K. Wang, B. H. Do, F. Stroppa, M. M. Coad and A. M. Okamura
Features: Four discrete joints optimised to achieve four different targets, Joint angle is controlled by varying the stiffness (via layer jamming)
Limitations: Limited rotation and bending

Authors: Y. Satake and H. Ishii
Features: Develops pitch-up motion based on heat welding, Maintains bending shape, Variable stiffness (via heat welding)
Limitations: Weight at robot tip limits mobility

Authors: P. E. Glick, I. Adibnazari, D. Drotman, D. Ruffatto and M. T. Tolley
Features: Branching improved reachability and enabled anchoring, Pouch anchoring reduces friction effects
Limitations: Limited by internal friction and head-on collisions

Authors: M. M. Premarathna, R. K. Weerasinghe, N. N. Peiris, A. L. Kulasekera and P. C. Dassanayake
Features: sPAM divided into groups, instead of single series, This sPAM arrangement decreased bending angle
Limitations: Asymmetry in sPAM configuration lead to variance in RS and LS steering

Authors: M. M. Hausladen, B. Zhao, M. S. Kubala, L. F. Francis, T. M. Kowalewski and C. J. Ellison
Features: Growth achieved via local photopolymerisation to solidify monomer solution before it exits illuminated region, Tuning chemistry allows for varying mechanical and physical properties
Limitations: Growth timescale limited to light source positioning, Growth length limited by available monomer volume

Authors: S. Grazioso, A. Tedesco, R. Sabella, S. Fusco, M. Selvaggio, L. Duraccio, E. De Benedetto, A. Lanzotti and L. Angrisani
Features: Thermocouple wire everts with robot body

Authors: S. Grazioso, A. Tedesco, R. Sabella, S. Fusco, M. Selvaggio, L. Duraccio, E. De Benedetto, A. Lanzotti, D. Dallet and L. Angrisani
Features: Thermocouple wire everts with robot body

Authors: K. Tadakuma, M. Kawakami and H. Furukawa
Features: Branching at arbitrary points using self-healing material
Limitations: Self-healing reduces time response of system

Authors: T. Takahashi, M. Watanabe, K. Abe, K. Tadakuma, N. Saiki, M. Konyo and S. Tadokoro
Features: Inserts multi-joint links into structure to increase rigidity and payload capacity
Limitations: Can only move along Z- axis, Rigid links limit aperture size robot can pass through

Authors: M. Selvaggio, S. Grazioso, S. Fusco, R. Sabella, G. A. Fontanelli, G. Di Gironimo, B. Siciliano and A. Lanzotti
Features: Larger fPAM diameter and denser material types maximise robot curvature
Limitations: Effect of friction and tension on results not considered

Authors: S. Wang and L. H. Blumenschein
Features: Representation split into spatial curve to describe geometry and kinematic curve to approximate spatial curve
Limitations: Workspace volume decreases as number of segments is increased

Authors: N. G. Kim and J. -H. Ryu
Features: Fabricated with hyperelastic material (latex), Bulging and shape-locking capabilities
Limitations: Viscoelastic properties of latex limit repeatability, Risk of bursting

Authors: Z. Wu, M. D. I. Reyzabal, S. M. H. Sadati, H. Liu, S. Ourselin, D. Leff, R. K. Katzschmann, K. Rhode and C. Bergeles
Features: 10-20 \% error between simulation and experimental results for curvature values, First physics-based model for tendon-driven growing robots
Limitations: Eversion unstable at large time steps, High eversion velocity leads to buckling

Authors: M. Bryant, C. Watson and T. K. Morimoto
Features: Tactile curvature sensors integrated onto pouches and distributed along body, Uniform stiffness along length of robot (as opposed to attaching sensors directly causing stiffness mismatch)
Limitations: Noise corrupts sensor measurements, so many measurements are needed for sufficient curvature sensing performance

Authors: A. M. Kübler, S. Urdaneta Rivera, F. B. Raphael, J. Förster, R. Siegwart and A. M. Okamura
Features: Novel cPAM steering- Each pouch selectively actuated at tip, High DoF using with few control inputs
Limitations: Functionality depends on manufacturing methods - limited by human skills and 3d printing resolution

Authors: S. Deglurkar, C. Xiao, L. F. Gockowski, M. T. Valentine and E. W. Hawkes
Features: Sensing-control-actuation loops embedded within sPAMs to steer robot towards heat source, Localised actuator response
Limitations: Slow response

Authors: T. Abrar, F. Putzu, A. Ataka, H. Godaba and K. Althoefer
Features: High manoeuvring and bending capability, Sharp bending, Stiffness control (by controlling pouch and main chamber pressure)
Limitations: Continuously changing shape limits control

Authors: P. Berthet-Rayne, S. M. H. Sadati, G. Petrou, N. Patel, S. Giannarou, D. R. Leff, C. Bergeles
Features: Miniaturised growing element
Limitations: Poor pressure resistance, High internal friction

Authors: A. M. Gruebele, A. C. Zerbe, M. M. Coad, A. M. Okamura and M. R. Cutkosky
Features: Senses environment around (temperature, humidity) and within (stiffness) the robot, Allows for shape reconstruction of robot
Limitations: Sensor protection equipment limits bending

Authors: T. Takahashi, K. Tadakuma, M. Watanabe, E. Takane, N. Hookabe, H. Kajiahara, T. Yamasaki, M. Konyo and S. Tadokoro
Features: Selectable extension direction, Retractable function
Limitations: Requires larger container / space, Risk of tube deformation at increased lengths

Authors: D. A. Haggerty, N. D. Naclerio and E. W. Hawkes
Features: High reachability and large workspace, Permits retraction and Limited by pressure, reducing growth speed
Limitations: Unable to fit through gaps smaller than diameter, Additional weight makes it difficult to pass through gaps

Authors: J. -H. Kim, J. Jang, S. -M. Lee, S. -G. Jeong, Y. -J. Kim and J. -H. Ryu
Features: Origami inspired material feeding tooltip mechanism, Camera remains at tip during steering
Limitations: Vision segmentation and pressure regulation lead to delays

Authors: P. Auf der Maur, B. Djambazi, Y. Haberthür, P. Hörmann, A. Kübler, M. Lustenberger, S. Sigrist, O. Vigen, J. Förster, F. Achermann, E. Hampp, R. K. Katzschmann, R. Siegwart
Features: Enables shape change and steerability, Portable, decentralised pressure supply
Limitations: Cannot direct motion properly in open spaces, Rigid head reduces shrinking capability

Authors: W. E. Heap, N. D. Naclerio, M. M. Coad, S. -G. Jeong, E. W. Hawkes
Features: Internal camera mount tooltip mechanism, Can pass through apertures smaller than its diameter
Limitations: Actuator force limited by strain, Limited change in orientation

Authors: N. D. Naclerio, A. Karsai, M. Murray-Cooper, Y. Ozkan-Aydin, E. Aydin, D. I. Goldman and E. W. Hawkes
Features: Tip extension reduces drag, Force modulation and control
Limitations: Can only be used for shallow soil depths, Lift force eventually saturates

Authors: C. Watson and T. K. Morimoto
Features: Real-time autonomous position and orientation control, Does not require map of environment
Limitations: Limited applications- magnetic sensors need to be placed in workspace, Limited accuracy

Authors: E. Del Dottore, A. Mondini and B. Mazzolai
Features: Sensorised head, Light sensing capability
Limitations: Only senses certain wavelengths of light

Authors: M. Li, R. Obregon, J. J. Heit, A. Norbash, E. W. Hawkes and T. K. Morimoto
Features: Millimetre scale, Improved bending and navigation compared to conventional catheter
Limitations: Requires manual labour, User needs to orient the tip manually

Authors: R. Jitosho, N. Agharese, A. Okamura and Z. Manchester
Features: Simulator runs in real time and handles environmental interactions, Amendable to motion planning
Limitations: Limited by computational constraints

Authors: F. Stroppa, M. Selvaggio, N. Agharese, M. Luo, L. H. Blumenschein, E. W. Hawkes, A. M. Okamura
Features: Shared autonomy between human and operator to increase situational awareness
Limitations: Human lacks autonomy during retraction

Authors: S. Grazioso, A. Tedesco, M. Selvaggio, S. Debei, S. Chiodini, E. De Benedetto, G. Di Gironimo and A. Lanzotti
Features: Enables remote measurement tasks and sensor delivery
Limitations: Complex motion analysis

Authors: S. Wang, R. Zhang, D. A. Haggerty, N. D. Naclerio and E. W. Hawkes
Features: More reachable than non-locking robot within the workspace, Multiple curvatures and configurations
Limitations: Manipulation only in two dimensions, Adding more tendons increases friction

Authors: M. Selvaggio, L. A. Ramirez, N. D. Naclerio, B. Siciliano and E. W. Hawkes
Features: Predicts interaction forces, Variation of air pressure in muscle actuators changes flexural rigidity
Limitations: Deformation can occur from variation of air pressure, transforming wrinkling to bending or vice versa

Authors: Y. Satake, A. Takanishi and H. Ishii
Features: Shape can be varied by changing inner pressure, Stable due to heat welding
Limitations: Needs a wall to bend around, One DOF less than other steerable robots

Authors: M. M. Coad, R. P. Thomasson, L. H. Blumenschein, N. S. Usevitch, E. W. Hawkes and A. M. Okamura
Features: Does not disturb the environment during growth, Prevents buckling during retraction
Limitations: Requires stronger steering actuators, Rigid retraction device limits gap sizes robot can pass through

Authors: N. D. Naclerio and E. W. Hawkes
Features: Low hysteresis, Ability to fold when depressurised
Limitations: Limited contraction, Limited to simple movements

Authors: A. Ataka, T. Abrar, F. Putzu, H. Godaba and K. Althoefer
Features: Variable stiffness (by varying pressure of pouches), 3 DOF manipulator
Limitations: Limited control, Trade-off between safety and accuracy

Authors: J. D. Greer, L. H. Blumenschein, R. Alterovitz, E. W. Hawkes and A. M. Okamura
Features: Uses obstacle interaction for navigation
Limitations: Limited growth, Inaccurate tip predictions for multiple obstacle interactions

Authors: A. Saxena, E. M. Pauli, R. S. Haluck, B. Fell and J. Moore
Features: Reduces insertion force and rubbing, therefore reducing intestinal damage
Limitations: Requires high user skill level

Authors: B. H. Do, V. Banashek and A. M. Okamura
Features: Distributed stiffness control (via layer jamming), Controls/ prevents buckling
Limitations: Jamming may affect tube inflation

Authors: S. -G. Jeong, M. M. Coad, L. H. Blumenschein, M. Luo, U. Mehmood, J. H. Kim, A. M. Okamura and J. -H. Ryu
Features: Tip mount remains at robot tip during retraction, Incorporates retraction without buckling
Limitations: Additional weight at tip reduces maneuverability, Rigid outer cap so it can't pass through small apertures

Authors: A. Ataka, T. Abrar, F. Putzu, H. Godaba and K. Althoefer
Features: Variable stiffness (by varying internal pressure), Can control tip's position and orientation
Limitations: Inaccurate kinematic model- does not consider friction and there is a limited number of sensors used

Authors: H. El-Hussieny, I. A. Hameed and J. -H. Ryu
Features: Enables closed-loop control of robot
Limitations: Limited by irreversible growing and actuation constraints

Authors: T. Takahashi, M. Watanabe, K. Tadakuma, M. Konyo and S. Tadokoro
Features: Water is used as internal fluid to increase ground pressure, Retracting motion using hydrostatic skeleton
Limitations: Increased weight of internal fluid restricts maneuverability

Authors: S. K. Talas, B. A. Baydere, T. Altinsoy, C. Tutcu and E. Samur
Features: Active steering by controlling extension speed, Variable stiffness (controlling tubing pressure)
Limitations: Limited position control, Not entirely soft

Authors: J. Luong, P. Glick, A. Ong, M. S. deVries, S. Sandin, E. W. Hawkes
Features: Permits retraction, Corrosion resistant
Limitations: Ability to withstand hydrostatic stresses

Authors: D. A. Haggerty, N. D. Naclerio and E. W. Hawkes
Features: Model incorporates transverse and axial buckling modes
Limitations: Model fails to capture coupling between buckles in close proximity

Authors: T. Abrar, F. Putzu, J. Konstantinova and K. Althoefer
Features: Extends when pressure is increased, Low weight and natural compliance
Limitations: Loss of power collapses whole structure

Authors: F. Stroppa, M. Luo, G. Gerboni, M. M. Coad, J. M. Walker and A. M. Okamura
Features: Comprises a one DOF gripper, Gesture-based control
Limitations: Lacks autonomy, Limited tasks

Authors: C. Tutcu, B. A. Baydere, S. K. Talas and E. Samur
Features: Pressurised tube stiffness, Active steering through independent control of actuator and tendon pressures in 3 DOF
Limitations: Buckling, Error increases with length

Authors: M. M. Coad, L. H. Blumenschein, S. Cutler, J. A. Reyna Zepeda, N. D. Naclerio, H. El-Hussieny, U. Mehmood, J. -H. Ryu, E. W. Hawkes and A. M. Okamura
Features: Capability to navigate through small apertures
Limitations: Slow growth speed, Lack of shape morphing at tip (due to rigid camera), Unable to retract after growth

Authors: V. Falkenhahn, T. Mahl, A. Hildebrandt, R. Neumann and O. Sawodny
Features: Capability to navigate through small apertures
Limitations: Slow growth speed, Lack of shape morphing at tip (due to rigid camera), Unable to retract after growth

Authors: A. Sadeghi, E. Del Dottore, A. Mondini and B. Mazzolai
Features: Obstacle avoidance using PLA, without sensory perception or bending control, Bending control
Limitations: Limited curvature / bending angle

Authors: E. Del Dottore, A. Mondini, A. Sadeghi and B. Mazzolai
Features: Global movement split into two paths / trajectories
Limitations: Noise and curvature affect ability in reaching

Authors: L. H. Blumenschein, N. S. Usevitch, B. H. Do, E. W. Hawkes and A. M. Okamura
Features: Helical body grasping possible, High dexterity and workspace
Limitations: Limited curvature

Authors: F. Putzu, T. Abrar and K. Althoefer
Features: Variable stiffness (by controlling pressure), Elongates linearly
Limitations: Unable to lengthen at forces greater than 4 N, Lacks control over direction of eversion

Authors: J. D. Greer, L. H. Blumenschein, A. M. Okamura and E. W. Hawkes
Features: Utilises obstacle collision for open loop navigation
Limitations: Erreneous steering, Complex

Authors: N. D. Naclerio, C. M. Hubicki, Y. O. Aydin, D. I. Goldman and E. W. Hawkes
Features: Single DOF, Depth can be increased with higher pressure
Limitations: Device does not pass beyond 4cm, Stops growing when resisting force of medium is greater than the force the robot applies to environment

Authors: H. El-Hussieny, U. Mehmood, Z. Mehdi, S. -G. Jeong, M. Usman, E. W. Hawkes, A. M. Okamura and J. -H. Ryu
Features: Maps human bending commands into movements, Roll-over free capability
Limitations: Trade-off between DOF controlled by human and accuracy in orientation measurements, Limited workspace in position mode

Authors: L. H. Blumenschein, L. T. Gan, J. A. Fan, A. M. Okamura and E. W. Hawkes
Features: Uses single tip-breaking mechanism, Active shape change
Limitations: Limited to shapes with low surface curvature, Requires manual labour

Authors: J. D. Greer, T. K. Morimoto, A. M. Okamura and E. W. Hawkes
Features: Controlled through decoupled steering, Corrections can be made during growth
Limitations: Environmental contact as the entire length of the robot body moves during steering

Authors: E. Del Dottore, A. Mondini, A. Sadeghi and B. Mazzolai
Features: Navigates through environment by responding to stimuli, Model can also be used for control and analysis of movement
Limitations: Melted filament shortens after each deposition, leading to systematic errors

Authors: P. Slade, A. Gruebele, Z. Hammond, M. Raitor, A. M. Okamura and E. W. Hawkes
Features: Variable stiffness (by controlling internal pressure), Reduction in shear and normal forces
Limitations: Limited steerability

Authors: H. Dehghani, C. R. Welch, A. Pourghodrat, C. A. Nelson, D. Oleynikov, P. Dasgupta and B. S. Terry
Features: Eliminates friction, Reduces risk of buckling
Limitations: Performance affected by fluid pressure, Risk of thermal tissue damage

Authors: A. Sadeghi, A. Mondini and B. Mazzolai
Features: Bending capability, Sensing capability
Limitations: Low resistivity of humidity sensors leads to overheating, Buckling effect limits spring's force

Authors: A. Sadeghi, A. Mondini, E. Del Dottore, V. Mattoli, L. Beccai, S. Taccola, C. Lucarotti, M. Totaro and B. Mazzolai
Features: Fast growing speed, PLA changes to ductile phase to permit bending to to follow or avoid stimulus
Limitations: Growing mechanism becomes unstable at heavier loads, Bending limited by lateral pressure of soil

Authors: L. H. Blumenschein, A. M. Okamura and E. W. Hawkes
Features: Quasi-static force balance
Limitations: Complex model due to inherent compliance, Apical extension limited to surface area

Authors: E. W. Hawkes, L. H. Blumenschein, J. D. Greer and A. M. Okamura
Features: Navigates toward light using camera, Directional control
Limitations: Limited resolution due to closely packed pouches

Authors: C. Girerd, A. Alvarez, E. W. Hawkes and T. K. Morimoto
Features: Tip-scrunching mechanism to provide accessible working channel at any point during deployment
Limitations: High friction between tail and working channel, limiting growth length and increasing pressure requirements

Authors: A. A. Valdivia, M. A. Rezqalla, S. E. Swann and L. H. Blumenschein
Features: Array of eversion growing robot pins, providing shape-changing haptic interface; passive, string-actuated reeling mechanism; compact system
Limitations: Limited height (depending on amount of available material) compared to other growing pin systems; hysterisis limits smooth transitions during growth

Authors: M. Al-Dubooni, C. Wong and K. Althoefer
Features: Hybrid eversion-continuum robot design; continuum robot placed at tip of eversion robot to enable highly localized steering and sharp bending
Limitations: Rigid internal steering mechanism limits robot compliance; tip-mount cap is friction fit, causing continuum robot to irreversibly slide off

Authors: H. Yong, F. Xu, C. Li, H. Ding and Z. Wu
Features: Coaxially nested cavity structure, extending synchronously; inner cavity inverts to enable grasping, outer cavity everts to enable tip extension; kinematic model to control steering and tip extension
Limitations: Higher buckling tendencies when navigating curved paths

Authors: S. Al Harthy, S. M. H. Sadati, Z. Wu, C. A. Seneci and C. Bergeles
Features: Functionalization of working flluid for both actuation and stiffening, miniaturization potential, high stiffness ratio
Limitations: Requires continuous heating, tip-growth limited to compliant state

Authors: J. Davy, N. J. Greenidge, S. Kim, L. J. Tinsley, P. Lloyd, J. H. Chandler, R. A. Harris, T. K. Morimoto and P. Valdastri
Features: Robot outer body doped with magnetic particle-based silicone for active steering; material-level response; can potentially be coupled with sensorless sensing
Limitations: Layer needed to be thin to avoid hampering the robots; magnetic layer needs to be thin to prevent it from hampering robot's flexibility so this limits the magnetic volume; outer magnetic platform needs to be placed very close to the robot

Authors: L. Behnke, B. H. Do, S. Eristoff and R. Kramer-Bottiglio
Features: Investigated self-interactions of eversion robots when navigating tight junctions; provides design framework for successful navigation
Limitations: Only tested on simplified pathways

Authors: B. Saldarriaga, C. A. Seneci, S. M. H. Sadati, Z. Wu, K. Rhode and C. Bergeles
Features: Laser-welding LDPE sheets; thin, strong weld lines; airtight welds
Limitations: Higher leakage tendency compared to heat sealing

Authors: J. Dinkel, D. Weinmann, P. P. Pott and M. B. Schäfer
Features: Material scrunching at the base to enable accessible working channel; working channel reduced buckling and improved retraction; colonoscopy-based application
Limitations: Friction between robot body and working channel impedes motion; jamming of scrunched material

Authors: K. Borvorntanajanya, S. Treratanakulchai, F. R. y. Rodriguez and E. Franco
Features: Model-based tip-tracking via pressure regulation

Authors: P. Vartholomeos, Z. Wu, S. M. H. Sadati and C. Bergeles
Features: Lumped parameter dynamic model comparing physics to experimental data
Limitations: Increased errors between experimental data and simulation at higher eversion pressures

Authors: Y. Satake, H. Ishii and S. Hirai
Features: Real-time heat welding of branches for simultaneous operation of multiple tips and buckling prevention
Limitations: No actuation/ bending mechanism, carrying mechanism components placed externally so they may come in contact with the surroundings

Authors: D. Kaleel, B. Clement and K. Althoefer
Features: Hydraulic PAM steering via volumetric pouch inflation
Limitations: Weight of pouches may limit use cases

Authors: D. Seo, N. G. Kim and J. -H. Ryu
Features: Modular vine with mini-vines pnematically  everting to push growth of the main sleeve, decouples pressure between inflatable structure and working channel for accessible working channel
Limitations: Possibly limited to larger scales

Authors: S. N. Boateng, S. Singh, M. Ugur, S. Wang, M. Kramer, I. Osei, O. Sobek, M. O. Martinez, F. Z. Temel, L. H. Blumenschein
Features: Scrunched at base, combines vine robot with RESCUE rollers to increase DoF
Limitations: Internal steering reduces compliance of system

Authors: C. McFarland, A. Dhawan, R. Kumari, C. Council, M. Coad and N. Hanson
Features: Tested for SaR in field, portable, can transverse debris and rubble
Limitations: Sensors limited compliance and eversion speed, high shear forces due to external sensor mount

Authors: O. G. Osele, K. Barhydt, N. Cerone, A. M. Okamura and H. Harry Asada
Features: Tip-clutching winch for robot to anchor to and reconfigure itself, overlapping belt friction increases pulling forces
Limitations: Requires winch to be positioned within robot's environment(which is not always possible)

Authors: W. E. Heap, S. Man, V. Bassari, S. Nguyen, E. B. Yao, N. A. Tripathi, N. D. Naclerio, E. W. Hawkes
Features: Largest vine (and soft) robot to date, 91cm diameter and 33m length, umbrella-like tip-mount
Limitations: Tip-mount interferes with robot compliance

Authors: N. G. Kim, N. J. Greenidge, J. Davy, S. Park, J. H. Chandler, J. -H. Ryu and P. Valdastri
Features: External actuation of magnetic tip, tip-localized high-curvature steering, rigid magentic component does not affect robot compliance
Limitations: Smaller magnetic tips lead to reduced magnetic volume, reducing effectiveness when down-scaling

Authors: A. Astar, O. Nurcan, E. Demirel, E. Ozen, O. Kutlar and F. Stroppa
Features: Pseudo-rigid body method to develop design otpimizer controller based on kinematics
Limitations: Do not take dynamics into account

Authors: M. Faqih, A. Ataka, A. I. Cahyadi and Y. K. Badriawan
Features: Deep reinforcement learning to navigate unknown, cluttered environments
Limitations: Distance sensing and target reaching is limited

Authors: G. Dimas, P. G. Kalozoumis, P. Vartholomeos and D. K. Iakovidis
Features: A* path planning of robot with localization based on 3D magnetic resonance images
Limitations: Relies on effective local steering strategies

Authors: R. Wu and S. Mintchev
Features: Modular vine with multiple interconnected tubes, reduces retraction forces at tip by decoupling retraction and inflation pressures, tubes are in-line with central-axis increasing stability
Limitations: Sensitive to Capstan forces so limited use in curved pathways; higher jamming tendency in curved or constrained paths

Authors: D. Ragab, E. Rendon-Morales, K. Althoefer and H. Godaba
Features: Electroadhesive pads on placed on bi-modular vine body to increase payload and grasping forces
Limitations: Limited scalability, electroadhesive pads can hamper robot flexibility during eversion

Authors: B. H. Do, S. Wu, R. R. Zhao and A. M. Okamura
Features: Multi-segment stiffness change via layer jamming, simple fabrication, improved response time (vs. Do et al., 2020)
Limitations: Scalablity comes at the cost of the effectiveness of layer jamming

Authors: A. Giri, C. Girerd, J. Cervera-Torralba, M. T. Tolley and T. K. Morimoto
Features: Linear actuator/ anchoring module placed inside growing robot to enable steering along curved paths
Limitations: Sharp bends reduce efficiency of inchworm motion

Authors: Z. Wu, H. Sadati, P. Vartholomeos, M. E. M. Abdelaziz, B. Temelkuran, G. Petrou, T. Booth, J. Shapey
Features: Tip-localized FBG-based force sensing; placed on internal steering catheter to prevent the sensor from being affected by dynamic eversion motion; smallest eversion robot (2mm)
Limitations: Sheath-catheter misalignment; miniature size leads to challenges in pressure transmissiona long robot

Authors: J. Davy, T. P. Dean, N. J. Greenidge, B. Calmé, P. Lloyd, J. H. Chandler, P. Valdastri
Features: Robot actuated via magnetorheological fluid, which is also used for steering; high magnetic volume without compromising on robot size or flexibility
Limitations: Magnetic platform needs to be within very close proximity to the robot

Authors: M. Kayser, L. Cai, S. Falcone, C. Bader, N. Inglessis, B. Darweesh and N. Owman
Features: Additive manufacturing growth via fiberglass- winding and weaving mechanism; fabrication sequence controls tube geometries and segment patterns
Limitations: Fibers are fabricated in parallel, often leading to collisions; lack of precise localization as no sensors are deployed

Authors: C. Suulker, S. Skach, D. Kaleel, T. Abrar, Z. Murtaza, D. Suulker and K. Althoefer
Features: Soft fabric cap slipped onto tip of robot; maintains position at tip without compromising compliance
Limitations: Extra layers (e.g. for jamming, or steering pouches) limit cap usability by blocking robot movement; Cap falls of during retraction

Authors: H. El-Hussieny, I. A. Hameed and A. B. Zaky
Features: NMPC to control robot movement via non-linear adaptive kinematics model

Authors: R. Manoj, A. H, A. Asokan, A. A. R, K. T. Abraham and D. G
Features: String-based tip mount, pulled during retraction to apply forces to the tip; Rollers at the head unit to prevent buckling
Limitations: No method for tool insertion

Authors: Y. Satake and H. Ishii
Features: Path-planning method for heat-welding-based growing robots; generates paths with constant bending angles
Limitations: Bending motion is irreversible due to welding; external forces can deform the yaw-axis bending leading to path errors

Authors: G. Bianchi, A. Agoni and S. Cinquemani
Features: Multi-segmented shape-locking via re-closable velcrostraps; reversible shape locking
Limitations: Shape-locking mechanism requires additional external components

Authors: A. M. Kübler, S. U. Rivera, F. B. Raphael, J. Förster, R. Siegwart and A. M. Okamura
Features: Compares the performance of pouch motors (+ quick actuation resonse), cPAMs (+ best bending performance, more robust), and fPAMs (pre-stretching fabrics leads to stronger bends and higher contractions)

Authors: F. Przybylski, Y. Adagolodjo, A. Mîra, G. Cerruti, J. Dequidt, C. Duriez and P. Berthet-Rayne
Features: Geometrical representation and parametrization of growing robots physics; local analysis based on FEM model at the tip

Authors: R. Jitosho, S. Simón-Trench, A. M. Okamura and B. H. Do
Features: Multi-bending; passive shape locking via hooks and loops; configuration can be chosen at time of deployment; easy fabrication
Limitations: Does not provide idealized bending (high disturbances when locking bends)

Authors: F. Fuentes and L. H. Blumenschein
Features: Variable stiffness via foam sprayed on the external robot body at arbitrary locations, as the foam dries it expands and stiffens; passively maintains rigidity and structure
Limitations: Slow response time (~1hr); external foam can damage sensitive environments

Authors: C. McFarland and M. M. Coad
Features: Studies the collapse of growing robots under their own weight for the first time; found that larger diameters collapse at larger lengths, and sharper launch angles improve performance
Limitations: Does not consider effects of external loading or deflection (which usually affects collapse)

Authors: F. Aljaber, A. Hassan, T. Abrar, I. Vitanov and K. Althoefer
Features: Gripping 'fingers' via eversion and bending robot mechanism; grips difficult-to-reach objects; local curvature tracking via vision-based approach
Limitations: Non-linear effects not accounted for in curvature estimation model, leading to errors at high pressures

Authors: M. R. Mitchell, C. McFarland and M. M. Coad
Features: Pressure sensors embedded inside steering pouches to detect forces along the robot's length; uses pressure-force relationship to determine contact forces; withstands change in robot configuration without compromising functionality
Limitations: Inaccurate pressures when high pressures are applied on the sides; reduced sensitivity with larger contact areas due to smaller pocket deformation

Authors: N. Agharese and A. M. Okamura
Features: Discrete bends and shape locking along the robot length by securing folds in the body; compares bend formation via ultrasonic welding, adhesive tape, and rigid connectors

Authors: C. Suulker, S. Skach and K. Althoefer
Features: Braided elastic bands integrated into robot body to create material imbalances between the two materials, improving bending
Limitations: Steering only in one direction; predetermined shape

Authors: A. Ataka and A. P. Sandiwan
Features: Deep reinforcement learning; superior to and requires less information on robot states than Jacobian controllers
Limitations: Only performs on simplified environments

Authors: G. Han, D. Seo, J. -H. Ryu and T. -H. Kwon
Features: Directional excavation with planar motion and retraction capabilities; high curvature and sharp steering capabilities within a limited radius
Limitations: Limited to planar motion; limited buckling control; cannot achieve multiple bends

Authors: E. Del Dottore, A. Mondini, D. Bray and B. Mazzolai
Features: Sensorised additive-manufacturing robot tip; provides constant airflow by deploying a fan at the base to improve circulation; Uses PCL filament due to its lower melting point
Limitations: No steering capabilities; PCL leads to high plotting friction, slippage during growth (as PCL is sticky), and irregular deposition (due to lower melting point slowing down cooling times)

Authors: D. Mishima, T. Aoki and S. Hirose
Features: Introduces the concept of eversion growing robots by presenting a tool capable of navigating rubble via pressure-driven eversion; string-mount wire-rewinding device to ensure head unit does not precede the robot
Limitations: No steering capabilities; high friction during retraction when the robot is bent

Authors: Z. Wu, S. M. H. Sadati, K. Rhode and C. Bergeles
Features: Autonomous steering framework with feedback from stereovision camera system and mechanics models
Limitations: Difficulty in steering arounf sharp curves due to friction between the robot and environment

Authors: S. Deglurkar, C. Xiao, L. Gockowski, M. T. Valentine and E. W. Hawkes
Features: Material-level response to steer the robot in the direction of light and/or heat; uses phase-changing fluid encased within steering pouches which increases pouch pressure during phase change, leading to bending
Limitations: Response is too slow for the provided application (fast acting fires); needs to withstand higher temperatures for the provided application

Authors: N. G. Kim, D. Seo, S. Park and J. -H. Ryu
Features: Retraction mechanism- as the retraction channel is inflated, a sealing ring moves forward. When depressurised, the sealing ring automatically moves backwards, inverting the robot; inner channel can be used for tool transmission during retraction
Limitations: Performance highly depends on the retraction channel size

Authors: M. J. Mendoza, N. D. Naclerio and E. W. Hawkes
Features: Can achieve tight curvatures and exert high forces simultaneously; variable stiffness via layer jamming (jamming pouches arranged in series along sides of robot and can be inflated independently)
Limitations: Heavily manual manufacturing of the growing robot tube/ structure, which may lead to discrepancies between samples

Authors: J. -H. Kim, J. Jang, S. -M. Lee, S. -G. Jeong, Y. -J. Kim and J. -H. Ryu
Features: Tip-localized steering via twisted string actuators positioned inside the robot at the tip; high curvature, lightweight internal steering mechanism; retraction device at the tip
Limitations: Rigid tip component, limiting compliance; too heavy to achieve 3D motion

Authors: F. Fuentes and L. H. Blumenschein
Features: Localization and mapping method for eversion robots based on collisions and deformations around obstacles
Limitations: High error rate in environments with low obstacle densities/ open environments

Authors: X. Pi, I. A. Szczech and L. Cao
Features: Flexible, incompressible retraction tube inside eversion robot: as the robot tail is retracted, forces at the tip become unbalanced due to the retraction tube leading to buckle-free retraction
Limitations: Buckling still occurs for curved configurations; growth length limited by retraction tube length

Authors: K. E. Tennakoon, G. S. Subasingha, J. A. Sewwandhi, A. L. Kulasekera and P. C. Dassanayake
Features: Growth, steering and buckle-free retraction in underwater applications; shows that tip force decreases with increased depths
Limitations: Robot velocity becomes highly dependent on water depth

Authors: D. Kaleel, B. Clement and K. Althoefer
Features: Uses helium as pressurization medium to achieve bouyancy and floating in air
Limitations: Kinematic model overly simplified and does not take external environment into account

Authors: E. Frias-Miranda, A. Srivastava, S. Wang and L. H. Blumenschein
Features: Contact sensing tip cap placed at the robot head to retrieve tip position at every instant

Authors: A. Raines, A. Lewis, J. Hwee and B. Hannaford
Features: Infers environmental changes (e.g. pipe diameter) via pressure and acoustic signal sensing at the robot base;
Limitations: Post-processed without giving real-time data; tested on simplified, freely growing robot with no consideration of external noise

Authors: F. Putzu, T. Abrar, J. Konstantinova and K. Althoefer
Features: Endoscopic eversion robot with high insertion depth and low shear forces so safer for navigating mucosal lining
Limitations: High frictional forces when inserting surgical tools through the lumen

Authors:
Ameya Pore?, Nicola Piccinelli?, Giacomo De Rossi?, Matteo Piano,
A. Pore, N. Piccinelli, G. De Rossi, M. Piano, D. Meli, D. DallAlba, R. Muradore and P. Fiorini
Features: Colonoscopy robot capable of retraction; wrapping mechanism of robot around a tube at the base for retraction
Limitations: Buckling during retraction; passive steering, partly actuated by pushing from the base

Authors: T. Abrar, A. Hassan, F. Putzu, H. Godaba, A. Ataka and K. Althoefer
Features: Inhomogeneous actuator design, with cylindrical upper half that everts and conical lower half that inverts; higher tip displacement and actuation strain than steering pouches
Limitations: Adhesive sealing puts it at risk of leakage and stress at high pressures

Authors: J. Hwee, A. Lewis, A. Raines and B. Hannaford
Features: Contact force and pose estimation via inflated beam theory
Limitations: High errors and inaccuracies when using nylon as the model assumes the material is isotropic, but fabric is anisotropic

Authors: J. Hwee, A. Lewis, R. A. Bly, K. S. Moe and B. Hannaford
Features: Multi-element system; Dual balloon eversion robot with passive steering- one balloon seals either the trachea or oesophagus, the other balloon grows through the alternative airway
Limitations: High shear due to contact-based steering; directional growth not controleld

Authors:
H. Tsukagoshi, N. Arai, I. Kiryu and A. Kitagawa
and Ato Kitagawa
Features: First steerable eversion robot; steering via two flexible flat tubes placed inside the robot, which are pulled independently to achieve bending
Limitations: High internal friction due to wrinkle formation when bending along curved paths; steering via traction makes it difficult to transmit sufficient forces to navigate sharp curves

Authors: H. El-Hussieny and I. A. Hameed
Features: Deep reinforcement learning for decision making during navigation; shape adapts in response to the environmeny; based on a discrete set of actions
Limitations: Limits precise motion compared to continuous action space approaches

Authors: E. Del Dottore, A. Mondini, N. Rowe and B. Mazzolai
Features: Additive manufacturing with a sensorized tip; Growth orientation dictated by external stimuli; Adapts material properties to self-support, grow axially, or perform twining-like motion
Limitations: FDM technique limitations: slow, irreversible, no retraction
